newsitem.title: USA: U.S. rice weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. rice weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA rice export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Rice: Net sales of 71,700 MT were three and four-fifths times the week earlier and two and one-half times the 4-week average.

Turkey (20,000 MT) was the primary buyer, with smaller quantities to Colombia (15,000 MT--all rough), Saudi Arabia (11,300 MT), South Africa (10,600 MT), the Dominican Republic (8,500 MT), Mexico (3,500 MT, of which 3,200 MT was rough), and the Netherlands (3,300 MT). In addition, reductions of 10,000 MT of rough rice were reported for Costa Rica.
Exports of 37,400 MT were 21 percent above the week earlier, but 31 percent under the 4-week average.
The major destinations were the United Kingdom (6,600 MT), Canada (5,000 MT), South Africa (4,700 MT), Mexico (3,700 MT), Haiti (2,800 MT), and the Dominican Republic (2,500 MT).
